bibl.title: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to the Director of the Mayo Clinic, October 25, 1947

div1.p: Wyllie requests photographs of Hench, and a dossier on him, to publicize Hench's upcoming speech at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to the Director of the Mayo Clinic, October 25, 1947
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
25 October 1947
DIVISION OF RARE BOOKS
AND
MANUSCRIPTS
My dear Sir:
div1.p:
Dr. Philip Hench of your Clinic is speaking at the
University of Virginia in November, and for purposes of pub-
licity I should like very much to get several good photos of
Dr. Hench to use at that time. I should also like to have
any dossier on Dr. Hench that would supplement the usual Who's
Who material, particularly in relation to his magnificent
Walter Reed work.

Will you be good enough to put this letter into the
proper hands for me?
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, John Cook Wyllie
Curator of Rare Books Director,
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
